articles.title: Gmail servers hijacked by malicious PyPI packages to spread havoc - here's how to stay safe
articles.author: Sead Fadilpašić
articles.summary: There were seven malicious PyPI packages that were sitting on the platform for more than four years and had more than 55,000 downloads. Most are an imitation of the legitimate Coffin package with names like Coffin-Codes-Pro and Coffin-Grave. Once installed on the victim device, it connects to Gmail using hardcoded credentials and contacts the C2 server. It creates a tunnel using WebSockets and bypasses most firewalls and other security measures. The attackers are able to send commands, steal files, run code, and access systems remotely.

articles.title: Challenging Traditional Economics: How Bitcoin's Unique Scarcity Affects Its Value
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: Bitcoin's growth rate is the lowest in the market at 0.84%. Fixed supply nurtures perception of Bitcoin as more valuable than the current market growth rate. Bitcoin's value is determined by the supply of the currency. Bitcoin has a fixed supply of value.

articles.summary: New research from NYDIG suggests that public companies with untapped issuance capacity could meaningfully raise bitcoin's (BTC) price. Greg believes this is a powerful market catalyst for bitcoin's price rise.    .   in the report published this week.

articles.title: Kraken Catches North Korean Hacker Posing As ‘Steven Smith' Applying for Job at Crypto Exchange: Report
articles.author: The Daily Hodl
articles.summary: A North Korean hacker posing as Steven Smith applied for an IT job at Kraken, a top crypto exchange platform. Kraken's chief security officer Nick Percoco confirmed the news to CBS News. He said that the hacker used a fake identity to apply for the job.

articles.title: Indonesia Freezes Worldcoin Amid Regulatory Storm
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Indonesian authorities ordered the immediate suspension of services related to Worldcoin and its digital identity platform, WorldID, in order to protect the integrity of the digital currency. WorldID is a platform that allows users to register their digital identity to the WorldCoin platform.

articles.summary: Rork's founders Levan Kvirkvelia and Daniel Dhawan came from financial ruin to secure a significant startup. The story of Rork's success resonates deeply in the world of technology startups, like the recent surge in the cryptocurrency market.

articles.title: Billions of Gmail users at risk with new phishing scam — here's how to spot it
articles.author: Loraine Centeno
articles.summary: An eerily convincing phishing message has been making the rounds in recent weeks bypassing Google's security protections and putting up to 1.8 billion Gmail users at risk. The message claims that a subpoena has been served and orders Google to produce a copy of the target's Google account content. Google is rolling out security updates to address the issue.

articles.title: CBEX Collapse And The Deepening Socio-Economic Crisis In Nigeria By T nice Mario
articles.summary: The China Beijing Equity Exchange (CBEX) collapsed two weeks ago, leaving investors stranded and unable to access their funds via the platform. CBEX is a legitimate government-regulated institution in China that handles equity transactions, mergers, acquisitions, and asset deals. The real CBEX publicly disclaimed any link to the fraudulent crypto operation. Nigerian-Kenyan scam operators stole the CBEX acronym to sound legitimate, but they had no connection to the real one. The deepening collapse of Nigeria's economy, compounded by rising hardship, continues to drive ordinary people towards colossal financial mistakes.

articles.title: Playtron Rolls Out Game Dollar Stablecoin For Gaming To Enable Purchases, Subscriptions And Rewards
articles.author: Staff Report
articles.summary: Game Dollar is a stablecoin for gaming. It will be used to power Playtron's GameOS operating system. Game Dollar aims to unify gaming ecosystems across platforms, where gaming economies remain mostly siloed, as GamesBeat reports.
